p: Studies on the effects of feed quantity are available regarding the GH-IGF system. In general, increased feed ration results in inverse changes in GH-IGF system hormones, compared to fasting ( 182, 198â€“ 200). This state in which plasmatic GH levels are low and IGFs are high is correlated with an increase in the somatic growth rate of fish ( 200). However, if feed ration size is considerable, plasmatic GH levels are high, and GHRs and IGFs levels remain low. This probably diminishes feed utilization for growth ( 199).
